intro: Anemopaegma villosum, commonly known as the hairy anemopaegma, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features soft, hairy leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
